parameters.name: inputName
parameters.description: The name you want to give to the input.

parameters.name: inputDefinition
parameters.description: The definition of the input. The attributes from the JSON payload that are made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to the AWS IoT Events system using BatchPutMessage. Each such message contains a JSON payload, and those attributes (and their paired values) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors that monitor this input. (dict) --- The attributes from the JSON payload that are made available by the input. Each such message contains a JSON payload. Those attributes (and their paired values) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors. An expression that specifies an attribute-value pair in a JSON structure. Use this to specify an attribute from the JSON payload that is made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to AWS IoT Events ( BatchPutMessage). The attribute (and its paired value) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors. Syntax: <field-name>.<field-name>...

nested_params.name: attributes
nested_params.description: The attributes from the JSON payload that are made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to the AWS IoT Events system using BatchPutMessage. Each such message contains a JSON payload, and those attributes (and their paired values) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors that monitor this input.

nested_params.name: jsonPath
nested_params.description: An expression that specifies an attribute-value pair in a JSON structure. Use this to specify an attribute from the JSON payload that is made available by the input. Inputs are derived from messages sent to AWS IoT Events ( BatchPutMessage). Each such message contains a JSON payload. The attribute (and its paired value) specified here are available for use in the condition expressions used by detectors. Syntax: <field-name>.<field-name>...

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the input. (dict) --- Metadata that can be used to manage the resource. The tag's key. The tag's value.

nested_items.name: inputConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the configuration of the input.

nested_items.name: inputDescription
nested_items.description: A brief description of the input.

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: The time the input was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdateTime
nested_items.description: The last time the input was updated.
